reviewText: This game is visually beautiful. I loved the backdrops and the designs of the characters. Gameplay was fun and pretty simple, though more than one playthrough is required to unlock all achievements.
voteText: 31 of 42 people (74%) found this review helpful

reviewText: From the first second Bitey appeared on the screen, I was hooked. It was one of the most relaxing experiences I'd ever encountered. The characters each have distinctive and charming personalities; they seem real, more so than many human characters in games. The rainforest is absolutely stunning, even at a lower resolution. The bioluminescence creates a soothing visual that relaxes the mind. The music adds to this soothing effect, with its mystical tone and flowing melody. The only negative point I can think of is its length; the game ends so quickly, while I want to explore more of the world presented in the game. But for this cheap price its really okay and worth it.
voteText: 15 of 15 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: CreaVures is a platforming game mixed with simple puzzle solving.  The puzzle part is to choose the correct creature to use in order to pass the level, or in order to grab all of the motes and essence laying around in the game.  The graphics aren't great as far as creatures go, though the background are beautifully done with an Avatar style of night-life irridescence.  Each creature offers a different option like a cat that growls at enemies (i.e. bats, birds, squirrels, monkeys, etc...) or hangs from fruits, a Porcupine that uses its quills to shoot the enemies or uses its quills to climb trees and leaves a ladder for others to use.  There a total of 5 creatures that you will collect during the course of the game.  The game doesn't take very long to beat, but the achievements are there to keep you playing if you're interested in that stuff.  The animation and pace of the game is very slow and tedious.  I felt that if the game allowed you to go at a greater speed that the game would keep your interest more, especially when you die and have to restart at the checkpoint.  It's done well, so if this is your kind of game, go grab it.  Overall a decent game to play with you children.
voteText: 10 of 10 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A boring 2.5d platformer with cute character design, an atmospheric soundtrack, funny cut-scenes, cool bosses, frustrating controls, and repetitive gameplay. It's similar to Trine, but without the co-op and cool physics.

You can swap between two different creavure, each with unique BDSM abilities (e.g., having a long sticky tongue, being able of electrocuting partners, and poking others with spikes) to solve platforming puzzles. More of these critters become available as you progress through the game, and therefore opens up new ways to solve more puzzles.

This game could be recommended only for young and/or casual players.

reviewText: Amazingly beautiful environments, and lovable characters with which you harness their individual talents to get through the puzzles. The soundtrack is enchanting and game play is enjoyable, I realy do enjoy every aspect of this game immensely, i find it great to relax to.

reviewText: This is one of those games which gets a free pass based on its artistic style. In this game you need to get some funky looking creatures through a black-light forest by using each of their special abilities. It would be nice if there was a two-player option, which I can't believe they didn't put in. CreaVures is nice enough that I was happy to put up with having to switch between two active creatures, making me feel like I was going back and forth quite frequently to accomplish the task at hand. Would I still buy it if I had the chance to reconsider? Of course. CreaVures looks awesome.

reviewText:
Absolutely love it. You play as five cute little critters trying to save their forest. Simple story, but very effective in context with the characters. The game is fairly short, which is probably the only drawback.

The puzzles are nothing overly complicated, but they are pretty fun and very relaxing once you get the hang of the mechanics and the character's special abilities. The pace isnt fast, but I dont see that as a negative. Personally, I loved the boss fights and wish there had been a few more.

The graphics are gorgeous, and the music is perfect for each level. The animations are well animated, and when it comes to the characters, the animations do an amazing job of conveying each critter's personality, especially in cut scenes.

Overall, well worth the price, and a sequel would be an insta-buy for me.

reviewText:
The visual style is what struck me first. Its simply stunning.

The Creavures themselves are stupid cute, I mean, I want a Bitey for a pet right now.

The levels are creative, fun, and give you enough little puzzles to solve.

There is some back-tracking built in if you want to get 100% on each level (need certain characters), and the teamplay mechanic needs to be improved, but overall, the game is quite enjoyable.

Family safe, cute, & fun. A worthwhile purchase.

reviewText: Not sure why this game gets such positive reviews, not because it sucks but because it's so mediocre. I'll start with the positives as always. The creatures are cute, the music and art style/atmosphere is nice, and it is fun how each creature has it's own power and you have to use them together to get things done.\nNow the problems. The game is super short, around 2.5 hours. The levels are short and super repeitive, just climbing ropes and branches and trees to get to the end, on basically every level. The levels all look the same and have the same layout. There are little essences to collect but since they don't have any purpose (literally nothing, no extras, art, unlockables, powers, etc.....just so it will show up you got x/x at the end) I just found myself skipping them altogether to beat the level faster. Using those for some point would have extended playtime and made levels more interesting, but since they didn't do anything they shouldn't even be in there. The enemies are the same and super repetitive. As for the creatures, you basically use the same 2 for like 1/2 the game, until you finally unlock the 3rd, and then unlocking more happens more often. Although they are fun to try out when you first get them, they become boring and repetitive to use. Each only has one power, so thats all you will use them for, is that singular thing. Although some levels you can go through with whatever combo you want, most you have to take a singular path and use a specific one, taking out all ability to customize your loadout or improvise at all, its basically just  use this guy for this area
date: this other guy for the next part
recommended: and so on". I would have liked more freedom. Also since they only each have 1 power they can only do 1 specific sort of obstacle. so the thing you use them for when you first get them you will only use them for that thing the entire game
hoursPlayed: with no variation. There are a few boss levels that change things up and make it a little more varied
voteText: which are a nice addition
helpfulPercent: but theres only like 3 the whole game
votesHelpful: so don't get your hopes up. The platforming is ok
votesTotal: if not a little floaty. Also you can get stuck on things a lot. On the flip side
votesFunny: grabbing ledges is very inaccurate and inconsistent
commentsCount: It constantly wouldn't let me when I hit right on
column16: and same for ropes. All in all its just a rather boring and repetitive game (have I stressed the repetition enough?)
column18: just doing the same thing on the same looking levels with the same puzzles
column19: for around 15 levels. It does work though and is passable. 6/10. Can't reccomend though as I didn't particularly enjoy it."

reviewText: Fun!  Not a difficult game by any stretch, but the atmosphere, music, and gameplay were very enjoyable.  Provides several hours' worth of casual gameplay in a darkly-lit, surreal world.  The cooperative aspect of the game was well-done.  And the characters are adorable.
voteText: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I wanted really hard to like this game, but I didn't get very far before decided I couldn't play anymore, sadly. Before I get to that, I'll lay out some positive things.

Pros
+ Relaxing pace
+ Pleasant music that meshes well with the world
+ Absolutely full of style
+ Competent platforming

Now for the unfortunate downsides...

Cons
- The CreaVures themselves do not follow eachother, forcing you to swap between them to progress, even in areas of little to no obstacles
- No co-op. The previous con could have been entirely nullified by this, though it would leave the single player experience the same. The setup is all but asking for local on-screen co-op

It makes me really sad that I have to give this game a thumbs down, but since those things were important to me, I had no choice.

However, if you can deal with those cons, this game is totally worth it.

reviewText:
A cute platformer with a good basis, awful pacing, and clunky controls.

I want to like this game, but the combination of slow gameplay and clunky controls (which are critical for a platformer) made me lose interest fairly quickly.

PROS:
-Cute characters
-Decent levels

NEUTRALS:
-The puzzles were fairly straightforward (I felt I was just going through the motions")
-A little short
-3 difficulty levels
date:
but you aren't told what is different between them. *shrug*
-Whats the point of these collectibles? There are the larger "flower" collectibles which seem to (mostly) represent side/secret areas. Those are good. What is the point of having so many of the small white collectibles though? It is never explained if they do anything or serve any purpose.


CONS:
-Very clunky controls
-Poor pacing
-Combat is awkward and doesn't seem to belong in the game
-Really SLOW animations that could not be skipped as far as I tried. The animations are very simplistic and too long!
-Since the creavures don't follow each other
recommended: it means you have to walk the same path literally twice. This is especially annoying in straight or simple areas."

reviewText:
First up, not actually a BAD game, but there are some weird design decisions which I don't understand and I can't really recommend it because of them.

Biggest one - you control multiple creatures but can't play co-op - this just means your multiple creatures are 'keys' you have to move around manually - it gets boring and it's mind-boggling that co-op wasn't included?

As with any platformer, there's a route to the exit and 'other stuff to find' - having to drag multiple characters to find that stuff (they don't follow and can't be abandoned) makes getting everything even MORE tiresome

The game also has a slightly weird look - I like the color palette but there's a certain gritty/grim/dimness to the graphics which is kinda odd (I suspect low quality textures - or a very odd fullscreen shader)

Animation isn't great either - some movements are accompanied by really janky things like you tail whipping instantly upright/downwards - it's quite visually jarring.

So - as I said, it's a serviceable platformer with some minor puzzles to solve but it does little which is novel, contains some odd design decisions etc. etc.

YMMV

reviewText: Fun small platform game in the same stile as e.g. Trine. You have five cute creatures, two at a time, with each their type of abilities, who needs to work together to save their forest. The game is rather short (took me around 4-5 hours to 100% it), but somehow it doesn't feel that short. Also, I really love the dark black and purple theme the game has going, and in generel just the art style (the creatures are really well done).

reviewText: If you ever need to relax, let your mind slow down, and smile...this is the game for you.  The bioluminescent visuals are both mystical and adorable.  The music is absolutely gorgeous.  The creavures themselves have more spirit and diversity than most AAA game characters.  The game is tragically short, but the game's charm and cheer more than make up for it.  Pay no attention to the low metacritic score; this is a game worth owning and playing over and over again, especially if you have a stressful life.  Also, Bitey is best critter.

reviewText: CreaVures is a cute little game that has you play as 5 little neon creatures. This game is a basic platformer with simple controls and not much of a story so to speak. Each creaVure has a different use, one can break things, another can climb, and another can bite things. Its up to you to figure out how to use each creaVure well. The game is only around 2/3 hours long and its worth it. For me it was $5 well spent on a simple game that is perfect to kill a few hours. reviewText: CreaVures is an attractice side scrolling action game cast in dark  violets and purples.  The game is more oriented around puzzle solving than direct combat and emphasizes strategic play by switching from one creature to the next in order to solve  mini-puzzles needed to progess.  The Steam Overlay and widescreen are both supported, and the music is appropriate for the overall atmosphere of the game.  The one minor complaint about CreaVures is the less than perfect controller support.    While the onscreen button tutorials and relatively easy control scheme make the game easy to learn, unfortunately the buttons do not seem to work on menus, requiring a switch to keyboard and mouse for that functionality.  Minor gripes aside, CreaVures is a solid action puzzle title and I would recommend it to any player interested in the genre.

reviewText:
So yeah, CreaVures. What does it mean? I don't know and I honestly don't care.
My friend gave me a free key and I thought, hmm looks cool, like something that I have played when I was a child. Not. Same type of genre of games for Sega Mega Drive were better. And here is why.

Yes, the game looks appealing, but that's about it. I hated that tail animation. I don't know why behaves like that, was that a bad expression or just a rig. But then, I found that some other objects in the game, for instance vines, behave the same ugly way.
The music is nice too, but the other thing that tipped me off straight away was the loading time. What am I loading for so long? My Coutner-Strike or Dota 2 maps load faster than that.

So in conclusion I must say, If by any chance you are a gamer, than you just going to waste your money ($6 usd) and regret it. I cannot recommend this game to anybody. Frankly I don't even think that my girlfriend would play this game, it's just so bad.

reviewText:
This game has problems. It feels like it was released early, before it had been refined. However, it has some positives going for it. If you have the tolerance to put up with the flaws, you might be interested in picking up this cheap game when on sale.

The game is really unique. The dark colors, ambient sounds, and nocturnal natural environment setting is very striking and I find it attractive.

The characters to play are indeed cute and unique.

The game is a simple platformer and, in that respect, it could have done better. Movements and actions could have been faster and required a bit more skill, but it is what it is. The teamwork aspect is simplistic and other games before it have done better. The game lacks a bit of refinement. It feels like they ran out of funding, drive, or just didn't have the tallent available to polish this game to the level it could have been.

Where CreaVures is weakest is it's user interface, some of it's audio, level scoreboard, and other in-between bits. It seems as though these areas were not the artists strengths. The end-level tune makes me cringe.

I regret that this title didn't get a bit more time in development, as I think it's reception could have been improved with a bit more work.

reviewText:
A good platformer where you control different creatures who have different cons and pros. All of the creatures are different, as in their personalities are different. It can easily be seen during the small cutscenes. Just amazing what you can give with so little.
Now the game itself makes you use the different abilities each of the creatures have to go forward. You can't leave one behind anyways, that's rude. You also collect motes and essence. You can collect all or if you want, just get to the end of the level. In general the game is slow-paced. Oh and looks-wise the game is great I'd say.
All in all a neat platformer to play if you have hours to murder and are good with slower paced games.

Lil' Sucky Gameplay to go with the review.
